modules.title: Introduction to Data Warehousing & Data Mining

summary: Database Management Systems is a comprehensive course designed to build strong foundational knowledge in this important area. This subject covers 5 key modules that progressively develop your understanding. You'll gain both theoretical insights and practical skills through lectures and assignments. The course prepares you for advanced studies and professional applications. Mastering this subject will significantly contribute to your academic and career success.
recommended_books: Fundamentals of Database Systems – Elmasri & Navathe
Introduction to Database Management – C.J. Date
course_outcomes: Define data definition aspects, classify data models and produce ER diagrams.
Describe and compare relational query languages and perform query processing/optimization.
Explain storage structures like B-Tree and B+Tree and analyze storage policies.
Analyze transaction processing, serializability and concurrency control policies.
State database security policies and evaluate database security and design advancements.
